org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player

Interface Player

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ArmorEquipable, Carrier, ChatTypeMessageReceiver, CommandSource, CompositeValueStore<DataHolder,DataManipulator<?,?>>, Contextual, DataHolder, DataSerializable, Entity, Equipable, Humanoid, Identifiable, Living, Locatable, MessageReceiver, ProjectileLauncher, ProjectileSource, PropertyHolder, RemoteSource, Subject, Tamer, TeamMember, Translatable, User, ValueContainer<DataHolder>, Viewer

    public interface Player
extends Humanoid, User, RemoteSource, Viewer, ChatTypeMessageReceiver
    A Player represents the in-game entity of a human playing on a server. This is in contrast to User which represents the storage and data associated with a Player.

    Any methods called on Player that are not on User do not store any data that persists across server restarts.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.spongepowered.api.entity.projectile.source.ProjectileSource

      • isViewingInventory

        default boolean isViewingInventory()
        Returns whether this player has an open inventory at the moment or not.

      • getOpenInventory

        Optional<Container> getOpenInventory()
        Gets the currently viewed inventory of this player, if it is currently viewing one.
        Returns:
        An inventory if this player is viewing one, otherwise Optional.empty()

      • openInventory

        Optional<Container> openInventory(Inventory inventory)
                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Opens the given Inventory for the player to view.
        Parameters:
        inventory - The inventory to view
        Returns:
        The opened Container if the inventory was opened, otherwise Optional.empty()
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a PluginContainer is not the root of the cause

      • openInventory

        Optional<Container> openInventory(Inventory inventory,
                                  Text displayName)
        Opens a given Inventory for the player to view with a custom displayName.

        Note that not all inventories support a custom display name.

        Parameters:
        inventory - The inventory to view
        displayName - The display name to set
        Returns:
        The opened Container if the inventory was opened, otherwise Optional.empty()

        Returns:
        True if colors are enabled in chat

      • simulateChat

        MessageChannelEvent.Chat simulateChat(Text message,
                                      Cause cause)
        Simulates a chat message from a player.

        This method sends a message as if it came from this player. To send a message to this player instead, see MessageReceiver.sendMessage(Text) or ChatTypeMessageReceiver.sendMessage(ChatType, Text).

        Commands cannot be sent using this method. To send commands, use CommandManager.process(CommandSource, String).

        If text formatting is not supported in the implementation it will be displayed as plain text.

        Parameters:
        message - The message to send
        cause - The cause for the message
        Returns:
        The event that was thrown from sending the message

      • getDisplayedSkinParts

        Set<SkinPart> getDisplayedSkinParts()
        Gets the skin parts that this player has allowed to render.
        Returns:
        A set of skin parts displayed

      • getJoinData

        default JoinData getJoinData()
        Gets a copy of the current JoinData.

        Since a Player is already online, it means that the player has joined the server at least once, meaning there is a guaranteed initial join Instant. Users may not have ever joined a server before.

        Returns:
        A copy of the join data

      • hasPlayedBefore

        default boolean hasPlayedBefore()
        Gets if the Player has played on the Server before. Added as a utility.
        Returns:
        True if played before, false otherwise

      • isSleepingIgnored

        boolean isSleepingIgnored()
        Gets whether this Player will be ignored when checking whether to skip the night due to players sleeping. The time in a world will be advanced to day if all players in it either are sleeping or have this tag.
        Returns:
        Whether this Player will be ignored when checking whether to skip the night

      • setSleepingIgnored

        void setSleepingIgnored(boolean sleepingIgnored)
        Sets whether this Player will be ignored when checking whether to skip the night due to players sleeping. The time in a world will be advanced to day if all players in it either are sleeping or have this tag.
        Parameters:
        sleepingIgnored - Whether this Player will be ignored when checking whether to skip the night

      • respawnPlayer

        boolean respawnPlayer()
        Manually respawns the player.

        If the player is not dead, this method will return false

        Returns:
        Whether the respawn was successful

      • getWorldBorder

        Optional<WorldBorder> getWorldBorder()
        Gets the WorldBorder for this player, if present. If no border is set, an empty Optional is returned.
        Returns:
        The WorldBorder of this player as an Optional, if present

      • setWorldBorder

        void setWorldBorder(@Nullable
                    WorldBorder border,
                    Cause cause)
        Sets the WorldBorder instance for this player to the given world border. If null is passed, the world border is unset.
        Parameters:
        border - The world border to be used, may be null
        cause - The cause of the border's change
